result.execSummary:
The defendant Nicole E Apicella was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Concurrent with: Concurrent with probation in La Crosse Co case 14CM1223, with conditions also concurrent
.

miscConds.notes:
Obtain and maintain employment

Obtain GED or HSED
.

Def to undergo Alcohol and Drug Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommendations.  If an assessment has already been done, another does not need to be done but the def should continue to comply with any treatment recommended
.

Def is not to consume or possess any alcohol or controlled substances without a prescription from licensed physician, with random testing

No Contact with Matthew S. unless PO approves it
.

Upon successful completion of all terms and conditions of probation, the record will be expunged under 973.015.
.

Court costs/fees are Waived on this case

Comply with CHIPS order

Complete any other counseling or treatment recommended by the PO

Pay restitution and 10% surcharge as shown in 14CM1223

Pay DOC Supervision fees

Credit for 5 days if probation is ever revoked

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of resititution victims and/or govermental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt

supervisions.notes:
Stayed for 45 days - def to report 4-7-17 at 5:00 p.m.

If the defendant is compliant with probation, the Court will vacate the balance of the jail sentence.  The Court will need something in writing from the PO by 4-5-17 that the defendant is compliant

Unpaid Court financial obligations are converted to a Civil Judgment
.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Nicole E Apicella

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: from PO Kinyon   re: Sentencing after Revocation / Rev Summary

9:32 am Def in court w/ Atty Jeffrey C. Mochalski.  Def in custody.  Jessica Skemp appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Nicole states she talked to Mr. Mochalski about this 2 weeks ago.  Court calls Mr. Mochalski.  Mr. Mochalski states he didn't have anything on his calendar.
Court will recall at 10:45 am
10:46 am  Case recalled   Nichole w/Atty. Jeff Mochalseki. Def in custody.  State by Jessica Skemp
Parties have reviewed revocation summary.  No changes to it.  Victim rights complied with.  Skemp comments.  Proposes 8-9 mos CJ w/credit and the balance on em for some structure.  Mochalski comments.  Asks for time served.
Court comments.  Apicella comments.
SENTENCE:  9 mos CJ w/166 days credit, stayed for 45 days.  Report by 5 pm on Apr. 7, 2017.  If you're compliant with your probation, I'll vacate the balance of your jai.  I'll need something from your PO by Apr 5th that you're compliant.  I'll modify the bond in 16CF-842 to add No alcohol or controlled substances and comply with JSS for drug and alochol testing.  CC converted to a civil judgment.

From: Def Re: req no contact w/Matthew S be lifed
TWB: this is to be left to DOC following last wks sentencing

Stmt of Neg Plea / Plea Quest & Waiver is filed

Ct 1 - Def pleads GUILTY

Uncharged LCPD incident# 10-14-7555 is Dismissed & Read-in / 14CF637 DRI
State has complied w/ Victim Notification
CRT:  plea is F, V & I made - Factual basis exists - finds def Guilty
CRT'S SENTENCE:  Sent w/held;  Probation 18 mos Concurrent w/ 14CM1223, w/ conditions also concurrent:  AODA & follow-thru - if an assessment has already been done, another is not needed but follow-thru w/ trmt recommended;  Comply w/ CHIPS Order;  Obtain GED or HSED;  Obtain & maintain employment;  No alcohol, drugs or cont subs w/o valid prescription, w/ random testing;  Complete any other counseling or treatment recommended by the PO;  No Contact w/ Matthew S. unless approved by the PO;  Pay Restitution & 10% rest. srchge as shown in 14CM1223;  CRT costs/fees are Waived in this case;  Credit for 5 days if probation is ever revoked;  Upon successful completion of all conditions, probation can terminate early upon PO's request;  Upon successful completion of probation, 973.015 is granted

2:54 PM - Def in court w/Atty Nicholas M. Layland.  Jessica Skemp appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
2/24 JSS violation report - crt allows Atty Layland the  new report
Layland; she's had issues w/ a pending action w/ her child that caused her stress  and she didn't come into test as reported. 
Skemp: leave up to court's discretion
def: I know that be missing my tests isn't excusable. I start trmt tomorrow and project proven on 3/3. 
Crt: I would be well w/in my rights to impose a cash bond given the violations. I won't modify the bond today other than to require you to report to JSS immediately after court and sign any releases for them to be aware of the recommendations 
BOND CONDITION: COMPLY  w/ the trmt recommendations made  at AODA eval and w/ project proven;  sign releases for JSS
